Sterling redirects here--> {{Infobox person | name = John William Sterling | image = Johnwilliamsterling.jpg | alt = | caption = | birth_date = {{Birth date|1844|5|12}} | birth_place = | alma_mater = [[Yale University]] | death_date = {{Death date and age|1918|7|5|1844|5|12}} | death_place = [[Causapscal]], [[Quebec]], [[Canada]] | resting_place = [[Woodlawn Cemetery (Bronx)|Woodlawn Cemetery]], [[New York City]], [[New York]] | resting_place_coordinates = {{coord|40.889|-73.8734|region:US_type:landmark|display=inline}} | known_for = Co-founder of [[Shearman & Sterling]]; bequest of $18 million to [[Yale University]] | occupation = Lawyer }} '''John William Sterling''' (May 12, 1844 – July 5, 1918) was a corporate attorney and major benefactor to [[Yale University]]. [[File:Hall of Graduate Studies, Yale.jpg|right|thumb|The Hall of Graduate Studies at Yale, whose construction was funded by Sterling.]] ==Biography== John William Sterling was born in [[Stratford, Connecticut]]. He graduated from Yale University with a B.A. in 1864 and was a member of [[Skull and Bones]].<ref>{{cite book | title=Prominent and progressive Americans: an encyclopædia of contemporaneous biography, Volume 2 | publisher=[[New York Tribune]] | year=1904 | pages=212 | url=http://books.google.com/books?id=W0YDAAAAYAAJ}}</ref> He was admitted to the bar three years later.<ref name="yaledn2011">{{cite web| title= The Sterling professors of Yale: evolution of a species | url= http://www.yaledailynews.com/news/2011/jan/21/fall-titans/ | publisher= [[Yale Daily News]] | date=January 21, 2011 | author= Jay Dockendorf | accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref> He obtained an M.A. degree in 1874 and an LL.D. from [[Columbia Law School]] in 1893. He became a corporate lawyer in [[New York]], and helped found the [[law firm]] of [[Shearman & Sterling]] in 1871, a firm that represented [[Jay Gould]], [[Henry Ford]], the [[Rockefeller family]], and [[Standard Oil]].<ref name="yaledn2011"/> On his death in 1918, Sterling left a [[residuary estate]] of $15 million to Yale,<ref name="nyt19180715"/> at the time the "largest sum of money ever donated to an institution of higher learning in history"—equivalent to about $200 million in 2011 dollars.<ref name="yaledn2011"/> After the estate appraisal was complete a year later, the Yale bequest was "about $18 million."<ref name="nyt19190823">{{cite web| title= Yale Receives bulk of Sterling Estate | url= http://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40716FD3F5A11738DDDAE0994DF405B888DF1D3 | date= August 23, 1919 | publisher=[[The New York Times]] | accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref> He required Yale to fund "at least one enduring, useful and architecturally beautiful building, which will constitute a fitting Memorial of my gratitude to and affection for my ''[[alma mater]]''" and "the foundation of Scholarships, Fellowships or Lectureships, the endowment of new professorships and the establishment of special funds for prizes"—these mandates led to the construction of the [[Sterling Memorial Library]], [[Sterling Law Building]], the [[Yale Graduate School|Hall of Graduate Studies]], and the [[Yale School of Medicine|Sterling Hall of Medicine]], and the endowment of the [[Sterling Professor]]ships.<ref name="yaledn2011"/> ==Personal life== Sterling died July 5, 1918 while staying at the fishing lodge of [[Lord Mount Stephen]] in [[Causapscal]], [[Quebec]];<ref name="nyt19180715">{{cite web| url= http://query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40716FD3F5A11738DDDAE0994DF405B888DF1D3 | title= Sterling Bequest to Yale | date= July 15, 1918 | publisher=[[The New York Times]] | accessdate=2011-01-25}}</ref> he is entombed at [[Woodlawn Cemetery, Bronx|Woodlawn Cemetery]]. Sterling's sister Cordelia donated the Sterling House and its surrounding estate —part of the [[Sterling Homestead]]—to [[Stratford, Connecticut]]. ==Notes== {{reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.outhistory.org/wiki/John_William_Sterling_and_James_Orville_Bloss%2C_1870-1918 John William Sterling and James Orville Bloss] from outhistory.org {{Authority control|VIAF=21225673}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Sterling, John William | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = Lawyer and Yale benefactor | DATE OF BIRTH = May 12, 1844 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = July 5, 1918 | PLACE OF DEATH = Causapscal, Quebec, Canada }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Sterling, John William}} [[Category:New York lawyers]] [[Category:Yale University alumni]] [[Category:Columbia Law School alumni]] [[Category:1844 births]] [[Category:1918 deaths]] [[Category:American philanthropists]]
